newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Labour party widens opinion poll lead.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Labour party widens opinion poll lead.

text.p: Britain's opposition Labour party has slightly increased its opinion poll lead despite a series of rows over policies but leader Tony Blair's personal rating has fallen to its lowest level since he took over.

A MORI poll to be published in Wednesday's The Times newspaper gave Labour 52 percent, up from 51 in late August, and said the Conservatives had fallen one point to 29 percent. The minority Liberal Democrats rose one point to 14 percent.
But the poll showed that Blair had been damaged by rows over whether he intended to sever Labour's traditional links with the trade unions and distance the party from socialism.
